Regular Expressions Cheat SheetÂ¶

Important difference: filename matching (filename.*) matches entire string, while regular expressions, by default, match a sub-string.

Meaning

Filename pattern

Regular expression

Single wildcard character

?

.

Match dot character

filename.type

filename\.type

Wildcard substring

*

.*

Character in list

[abc]

[abc]

Character in range

[0-9]

[0-9]

Character not in list

[!ab^c]

[^ab^c]

Zero or more occurances

(abcd)* x*

One or more occurances

(abcd)+ x+

Optional

(abcd)? x?

Match at the beginning

pattern*

^pattern

Match at the end

*pattern

pattern$

Match entire string

pattern

^pattern$
